channel.description: Recent content in database on Dr. Dominic Royé

item.title: Accessing OpenStreetMap data with R
item.description: Recently I created a map of the distribution of gas stations and electric charging stations in Europe. How can you obtain this data? Well, in this case I used points of interest (POIs) from the database of Open Street Maps (OSM). Obviously OSM not only contains the streets and highways, but also information that can be useful when we use a map such as locations of hospitals or gas stations.

item.title: The use of climate databases netCDF with array structure in the environment of R
item.description: Used datasets are available for download here. Alternative datasets for Spain in ncdf format can be downloaded: AEMET Gridded 20km and 50km (precipitation and temperature) Gridded 5km (precipitation) CSIC Gridded 5km (precipitation)
